Number Theory | Chinese Remainder Theorem: Example 2

\begin{aligned}\n&\begin{array}{l}\n\text { Remainder } \\\n\text { w } x \equiv 3(\bmod 5) \\\n\text { g } x \equiv 2(\bmod 6)\n\end{array}\\\n&\mathbf{x} \equiv \mathbf{1}(\bmod \mathbf{7})\n\end{aligned}[imath]\text { Remainder } [/imath] [imath]\text { w } x \equiv 3(\bmod 5) [/imath] [imath]\text { g } x \equiv 2(\bmod 6)[/imath]
